body:
@criccomini 
Re: diff between PRs
1. I did not cover deidentify-templates and job_triggers api calls in the hook, while @ryanyuan did. 
2. He has multiple operators corresponding to each single API calls, while I have only one run_dlp_job() operator to create a dlp-job asynchronously and keep polling its status until finish or fail/cancel, which calls create_dlp_job() and get_dlp_job().
@criccomini, @ryanyuan seems to have multiple operators here: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/5539/commits/ecb67a2d68a0fa189e1b3810e65c1489604bb3bd#diff-03cb053ae7181e1396bf2d07ec755dc6
Ah ha. Somehow GH wasn't loading full diff. :|

Can we get either one of these in 1.10.4?

cc @ashb
I'm fine with either PR. I just want to be able to either 1) cherry pick it into 1.10.3 with minimal merge conflicts and have it work or 2) get it into 1.10.4 so we can use it...
it does not have to go into the release so you can use it.  All you have to do is copy files with hook and operator to your directory with Airflow and import operators, like any other Python class.

Yes, I'm aware of that. However, we don't fork open source projects. Without a commit in master, copy/paste starts to border on fork-ish. What I'm asking in (1) is a clean cherry pick, which at least means we're using a commit that's on master.

Also, for the record, @alexvanboxel and I discussed a long time ago about whether to use the discovery library or the idiomatic client, and landed on discovery because of the more immediate API access and also because of incompatibility between the discovery library and google-cloud library transitive dependencies. If you guys are changing this, please don't post them in a private Google doc buried in a thread from 2018.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-15

So, yea, here's the JIRA where we explicitly remove GCloud client

And here's the (still open) JIRA where we rebase the old stuff:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-1894

Anyway.. mostly just grumbling that none of this is clearly documented. We burned quite a bit of time on this.

I found if we use RBAC UI with LDAP, `pip install apache-airflow[ldap]` won't work, instead we should use `pip install python-ldap`, which is FAB needed.
As RBAC UI will be the default UI of Airflow, do you think we should modify the ldap description in setup.py or installation.rst?

The f-string format is not valid syntax in Python3.5. Change it to str.format() might solve this failure.

Hi, does anyone have any suggestion for this PR?
Else, would any of the committers approve/merge it?

@ashb @mik-laj It seems Travis failed on tests.www.test_views.TestAirflowBaseViews.test_clear. Any ideas?

This change means that key_file specified in the hook is with higher priority than the key_file specified in the connection extra_options. Maybe good to add a short note in the hook docstring.

@johnchenghk01 Unfortunately this is an implementation detail of the [`conf.get` on a dict ](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/8f41eb75ad33a7edfeb2414d905e9b51fff3732a/airflow/configuration.py#L208).

@XD-DENG 

Airflow always gives priority to settings passed to hook upon default of Connection.
It's very practical as this allows you to overwrite default.
For example if you specified schema in connection you want to allow users to overwrite the schema in the hook so they will be able to interact with other schema in the database. This is not different than what this PR is trying to fix.
Examples for priority of hook upon connections from:
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/airflow/hooks/hive_hooks.py#L101
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/airflow/hooks/mysql_hook.py#L78

PR https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/5155 which attempted to fix the issue actually did the opposite thing. It ignored the parameter passed to the hook and gave priority to the Connection.
Since the fix to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-4136 was not yet released (1.10.4) I don't think we need to update ` Update.md`

What do you think?
